date.headline: Tim Berners-Lee prototyped ENQUIRE
date.text: ENQUIRE was a document exchange system used in CERN. It had pages called cards and hyperlinks within them which resembles modern HTML concepts.

date.headline: Tim Berners-Lee specified HTML and implemented the browser and server software
Release of the “HTML Tags” document
date.text: “HTML Tags” was the first publicly available description of the language; it included 18 basic HTML elements, 11 of which are still used nowadays.

date.headline: IETF released the first draft of the HTML specification
HTML Working Group published the specification of “HTML 2.0”
HTML 4.01 was published as a W3C Recommendation
HTML5 was published as a W3C Recommendation
